It implements the UUPS upgradeable pattern and uses AccessControl for role-based permissions.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"AddressEmptyCode(address)":[{"details":"There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract)."}],"ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address)":[{"details":"The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid."}],"ERC1967NonPayable()":[{"details":"An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost."}],"FailedCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"batchClaimReward(uint256[])":{"custom:throws":"PeriodNotEnded if any specified period has not yet endedNotSetReward if no reward has been set for any specified periodAlreadyClaimed if the caller has already claimed their reward for any period","details":"Calls claimReward for each period number in the array, which performs all necessary validations","params":{"periodNumbers":"An array of period numbers for which rewards are being claimed"}},"claimReward(uint256)":{"custom:throws":"PeriodNotEnded if the specified period has not yet endedNotSetReward if no reward has been set for the specified periodAlreadyClaimed if the caller has already claimed their reward for this period","details":"The reward amount is calculated based on the user's contribution relative to the total contributions for the specified period and tag. The formula is: (totalReward * userContribution) / totalContributions","params":{"periodNumber":"The period number for which the reward is being claimed"}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"getClaimableReward(uint256,address)":{"details":"The reward amount is calculated based on the user's contribution relative to the total contributions for the specified period and tag. Returns 0 if the period has not ended, no reward has been set, or the user has already claimed their reward.","params":{"periodNumber":"The period number for which to calculate the claimable reward","user":"The address of the user for whom to calculate the claimable reward"},"returns":{"_0":"The amount of tokens the user can claim as reward for the specified period"}},"getCurrentPeriod()":{"details":"This is a pass-through function to the Contribution contract's getCurrentPeriod function","returns":{"_0":"The current period number"}},"getReward(uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether a reward has been set and the reward amount for the given period","params":{"periodNumber":"The period number for which to retrieve reward information"},"returns":{"_0":"A tuple containing:         - A boolean indicating whether a reward has been set for the period         - The total reward amount for the period (returns 0 if not set)"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address)":{"custom:throws":"AddressZero if any address parameter is the zero address","details":"This function can only be called once due to the initializer modifier","params":{"_admin":"Address that will be granted the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE","_contribution":"Address of the Contribution contract for accessing contribution scores","_intmaxToken":"Address of the INTMAX token used for reward distribution","_rewardManager":"Address that will be granted the REWARD_MANAGER_ROLE"}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setReward(uint256,uint256)":{"custom:throws":"RewardTooLarge if amount exceeds uint248 max valueAlreadySetReward if reward for this period has already been set","details":"Only callable by accounts with the REWARD_MANAGER_ROLE","params":{"amount":"The total amount of tokens to distribute as rewards for the given period","periodNumber":"The period number for which the reward is being set"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"stateVariables":{"BLOCK_POST_TAG":{"details":"Used to query contribution scores from the Contribution contract"},"REWARD_MANAGER_ROLE":{"details":"Accounts with this role can call the setReward function to allocate tokens for each period"},"claimed":{"details":"First key is period number, second key is user address, value is whether claimed"}},"title":"BlockBuilderReward","version":1},"userdoc":{"errors":{"AddressZero()":[{"notice":"Error thrown when an address parameter is the zero address"}],"AlreadyClaimed()":[{"notice":"Error thrown when a user tries to claim a reward that has already been claimed"}],"AlreadySetReward()":[{"notice":"Error thrown when owner tries to set a reward that has already been set"}],"NotSetReward()":[{"notice":"Error thrown when a reward is not set for a given period"}],"PeriodNotEnded()":[{"notice":"Error thrown when a user tries to claim a reward for a period that has not ended"}],"RewardTooLarge()":[{"notice":"Error thrown when owner tries to set a reward that is bigger than 2^248"}]},"events":{"Claimed(uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a reward is caller's share of rewards for a specific period"},"claimed(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Mapping to track which users have claimed rewards for which periods"},"constructor":{"notice":"Constructor that disables initializers to prevent implementation contract initialization"},"contribution()":{"notice":"Reference to the Contribution contract for accessing contribution scores"},"getClaimableReward(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Calculates the claimable reward amount for a specific user and period"},"getCurrentPeriod()":{"notice":"Retrieves the current period number from the Contribution contract"},"getReward(uint256)":{"notice":"Retrieves the reward information for a specific period"},"initialize(address,address,address,address)":{"notice":"Initializes the contract with required dependencies"},"intmaxToken()":{"notice":"Reference to the INTMAX token contract for reward distribution"},"setReward(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the total reward amount for a specific period"},"totalRewards(uint256)":{"notice":"Mapping of period numbers to their total reward information"}},"notice":"Contract for managing and distributing rewards to block batchClaimReward(uint256[]).custom:throws: PeriodNotEnded if any specified period has not yet endedNotSetReward if no reward has been set for any specified periodAlreadyClaimed if the caller has already claimed their reward for any period
batchClaimReward(uint256[]).details: Calls claimReward for each period number in the array, which performs all necessary validations

params.periodNumbers: An array of period numbers for which rewards are being claimed

claimReward(uint256).custom:throws: PeriodNotEnded if the specified period has not yet endedNotSetReward if no reward has been set for the specified periodAlreadyClaimed if the caller has already claimed their reward for this period
claimReward(uint256).details: The reward amount is calculated based on the user's contribution relative to the total contributions for the specified period and tag. The formula is: (totalReward * userContribution) / totalContributions

params.periodNumber: The period number for which the reward is being claimed

getClaimableReward(uint256,address).details: The reward amount is calculated based on the user's contribution relative to the total contributions for the specified period and tag. Returns 0 if the period has not ended, no reward has been set, or the user has already claimed their reward.

params.periodNumber: The period number for which to calculate the claimable reward
params.user: The address of the user for whom to calculate the claimable reward

returns._0: The amount of tokens the user can claim as reward for the specified period

getCurrentPeriod().details: This is a pass-through function to the Contribution contract's getCurrentPeriod function

getReward(uint256).details: Returns whether a reward has been set and the reward amount for the given period

params.periodNumber: The period number for which to retrieve reward information

returns._0: A tuple containing:         - A boolean indicating whether a reward has been set for the period         - The total reward amount for the period (returns 0 if not set)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:throws: AddressZero if any address parameter is the zero address
initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: This function can only be called once due to the initializer modifier

params._admin: Address that will be granted the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE
params._contribution: Address of the Contribution contract for accessing contribution scores
params._intmaxToken: Address of the INTMAX token used for reward distribution
params._rewardManager: Address that will be granted the REWARD_MANAGER_ROLE

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setReward(uint256,uint256).custom:throws: RewardTooLarge if amount exceeds uint248 max valueAlreadySetReward if reward for this period has already been set
setReward(uint256,uint256).details: Only callable by accounts with the REWARD_MANAGER_ROLE

params.amount: The total amount of tokens to distribute as rewards for the given period
params.periodNumber: The period number for which the reward is being set

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

REWARD_MANAGER_ROLE().notice: Role that grants permission to set reward amounts for distribution periods

batchClaimReward(uint256[]).notice: Claims the caller's share of rewards for multiple periods in a single transaction

claimReward(uint256).notice: Claims the caller's share of rewards for a specific period

claimed(uint256,address).notice: Mapping to track which users have claimed rewards for which periods

constructor.notice: Constructor that disables initializers to prevent implementation contract initialization

contribution().notice: Reference to the Contribution contract for accessing contribution scores

getClaimableReward(uint256,address).notice: Calculates the claimable reward amount for a specific user and period

getCurrentPeriod().notice: Retrieves the current period number from the Contribution contract

getReward(uint256).notice: Retrieves the reward information for a specific period

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: Initializes the contract with required dependencies

intmaxToken().notice: Reference to the INTMAX token contract for reward distribution

setReward(uint256,uint256).notice: Sets the total reward amount for a specific period

totalRewards(uint256).notice: Mapping of period numbers to their total reward information
